reviewText:
From someone who has over 500 hours in this game, I can tell you that this game is not worth $1, not anymore atleast.

It used to be fun in alpha, before they started tweaking everything, and giving streamers special treatment, and hiring people who bashed the game constantly.

There's bugs everywhere, there's always been bugs, and there will always be bugs because the developers are either clueless or were only trying to make a quick buck. Also, they didn't take one small thing from all the other MMO's.. A Public Testing Server.. As obvious as it might seem, that's something these money hungry developer's either didn't consider or just plain over looked due to costs / labor.

There's been a cheating problem since the beginning and there will always be a cheater problem because instead of investing in an actual anti-cheat (Their current one is FairFight and it records statistics, all in-game bans are done by hand.) I seriously recommend you not play this unless you plan on cheating yourself because that is the only way you'll ever survive, unless you're actually somewhat decent at FPS's, which,  in that case, be prepared to be banned at random times because a streamer or someone well known in the community said you cheated.

In the beginning, the developers stole their terms of service from League of Legends, banned people at random times to scare off cheaters (their version of an anti-cheat), and used fake screenshots which resulted in the game originally being pulled from steam. (Seriously.) It's for some reason been allowed back onto steam, and I believe everyone should know of this games terrible past and know that it's not changed one bit. Sergey Titov OP Productions
date: LLC. CEO" (Previously known as Hammerpoint Productions) even went as far as to lie in interviews about this game
recommended: and delete any comments or reviews that said otherwise.\n\nPlayers who requested a refund originally were reported and blacklisted from the website which then caused them to have international troubles making any further purchases for anything
hoursPlayed: even things not involved with online games
voteText:
I.E. General online shopping..

Taken directly from a mod who previously worked for Hammerpoint / OP Productions

http://leviathyn.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/11/t6F9c.jpg (Source - http://www.leviathyn.com/news/2012/11/29/the-warz-team-blacklists-customers-asking-for-refunds-and-gets-blasted-by-ex-mod/ )

Avoid this game at all costs."

reviewText:
├Honest Review┤Review is based on current state of game.

Game Pros
• Open world
• Multiplayer
• Grouping System
• Looting
• Day/Night Cycle
• Vehicles (Ground only)


Game Cons
• Developers ignore community
• Slow Spawning/loading times
• Un-balanced map/loot
• Horrible Optomization
• Hackers/Script users
• Un-Polished Character models
• Broken Promises

Relateable Games
• Nether

ConclusionInfestation: Survivor Stories turned out to be a let down. Sure, some people have fun. But the majority despises it. The only time I remember enjoying myself in it, was upon release, hence the 200+ hours I have in game from forever ago. In the beginning it had a lot of hope, but it's nothing but a deathmatch game now.

(If you found this review helpful, consider giving it a thumbs up!)

reviewText: How to create a bad game ? It's pretty simple. At first you have to get an inspiration. To find it you will need a popular game. Cool ! You have selected Day Z ! Now, create a badly detailed terrain and add some villages which look almost exactly the same. Ok, now take all of the bugs that exist in Day Z and add them to the game. Well, we already have a bad looking glitched map ! Now it's time for some gameplay. Create a typical american character, put some badass clothes on it, make him muscular, add a cool face expression and steal all the animations from Fallout 3 just to make it look like a cowshit. Don't forget that you have to let this guy shoot and wear some armor ! You just have to place deadly military weapons all over the map. Especially in supermarkets ! Everyone knows that a real supermarket should offer a good shotgun next to BBQ accesories. Now, when your character is able to run around with a submachine gun you have to place some targets. Exactly ! Spawn thousands of zombies which must be as glitched as the map (it has to create a perfect composition) and make their corpses bulletproof. Good job ! Now your map is filled with supernatural people living after death who can't get killed after 2000 shots in the torso but they die after a one punch in the head by a flashlight ! Now it's the time for the final spice, a cherry at the top of a cake ! It's time for a Pay 2 Win model. There is no such a thing that would make this game even worse than a Pay 2 Win model. A market with dozens of overpowered weapons which you are able to buy for real money ! That's what we need ! Congratulations ! You've just made an another useless game ! Keep on going with such projects ! Community will appreciate the effort that you've put in this project !

reviewText:
Unfortunately I had very bad experiences with this game in its entirety. There is an enormous amount of cheating going on, and the ban waves regularly ban non-cheaters. If I had to guess my Kill to Death ratio was somewhere around 1 to 10, if not worse- but I was scooped up in a ban wave as well.

It uses an automated ban system, and they do not use any active moderation for banning. The notorious aimbot sites like artificial are still selling functional cheats that cannot be detected, so their only solution to this was banning anyone who has been reported.

I was playing on a stream where it was visible I was not cheating and was still banned. Let that be a warning to other people looking to play this...... game". I submitted a request to have my ban investigated
date: three months later I still had not received any word back.\n\nUnfortunately I was stupid enough to pay 5$ for the in game currency to purchase one of the survivors. Several friends who also paid for in game content were "caught" in the ban waves. No way to fight it
recommended: no refunds. Let that speak for itself.\n\nAs you can see I had over 155~ hours in the game
hoursPlayed: and I tried very hard to give it a fair chance. There were a lot of good core ideas
voteText: but in the end it's a very poor attempt to cash in on DayZ popularity with no respect for the player base."

reviewText:
I want to be fair to this game but so far my experiences with it have been really bad.

You start by getting thrown into the wild miles from everything with no idea what to do, when you finally make it to somewhere you're forced to sneak about in near useless fashion to collect supplies and HOPE you get a decent weapon- which doesn't matter if it's melee because the combat in this game is just dreadful.

Having to run for 40 minutes through nothing is also dreadful.

Oh and the stupid zombie movement and that delightly lag thing when enemies hit you where you were rather than where you are.

I cannot in a clear mind recommend this game in it's current state because so far I've yet to find anything positive to say and I truly regret buying this game. I hope it gets better and become worth the time but right now, it's not worth it.

reviewText: Infestation: Survivor Stories ( better known as The WarZ ) is a zombie survival sim. It's absolutely horrible, though. The devs took a great idea that had so much potential and... well, turned it to crap basically. Let's start our review off with the Graphics. They aren't bad, but they aren't special or anything. They're just your average everyday video game graphics. Next up, the gameplay. Well, like I said, great idea turned to crap. You can explore a large open-world (if you don't crash within the first 5 minutes of joining a server), which has a wide array of locations from cities to abandoned shacks in the forest. You can explore these areas in hope of finding basic supplies, such as food, water, and health. Once you have the basics covered, you can begin looking for more things that aren't nessecary, but make the game alot easier, such as weapons and armor. Of course, being a zombie survival game, the thing contains zombies. In my short time playing the game, I found zombies teleporting around, spotting you from miles away, and attacking you when they weren't even near you. With the help of microtransactions, you can buy points to use in an in-game store (which kinda ruins the whole survival aspect). I don't know if this was fixed from the time I played, but if you bought points and your character dies, the points die" with the character. Just imagine buying 15 dollars worth of digital credits
date: only for a zombie to bite you a second after the purchase- 15 dollars down the drain. The replayability would be high
recommended: considering you have an urge to play everytime you die and improve. But
hoursPlayed: because of the state of the game

The game is set out alright and the atmosphere isn't to bad but still cheap.

Buy this game right now if you want but I warn you its garbage.
If you really want us spending money for this so called game fix it up and update it every bloody week. If not, continue being scammers and using our money to watch your HD p***

reviewText:
The only reason I didn't uninstall this crap is to be able to give it a negative review!

I got this on sale with a coupon for under $4 and I still feel ripped off!

Basically, they just made a terrain and some controllable characters... and that's it. I would like to discuss game mechanics or game play, but there isn't any. You get a character with horrible and in some cases barely responsive controls, so you can glitch around a horrible world design. I was in  situation where I couldn't jump over 1 foot fence, but I had no problem walking over and on top of people.

Fight mechanics... HA! You will spend hours just watching what seems to be a 2 frame motion of your character moving his hand up and down.... up and down... up and down ... until you or the attacker drop. There really is no game here. They use the term Open World" to hide the fact that they didn't ( or couldn't) make such a broken world work for anything else. reviewText:
DISCLAIMER: I PLAYED THIS GAME BEFORE IT WAS RELEASED TO STEAM AND EVERYONE GOT A SPECIAL KEY!!!!! DON'T COMMENT IF YOU HAVE NO CLUE!

Infestation: Survivor Stories; original The War Z, the worst game created currently.

Graphics

The graphics are terribly made, the animation is worse than Diablo 1 back then and they run like in Diablo 1. My i7-3770k 4,0 GHz CPU can't handle this game, my GPU is a GeForce GTX670 4GB Tri-Force, and i have FPS drops. Even Assassins Creed IV: Black Flag is running better.

Sound

The gunweapons sound like recorded with a phone instead of something better out there. Zero atmosphere, i feel like a zombie, not a survivor. The steps are giving me issues.

Gameplay

Infestation: Hacker Stories is a better term for this game. The weapons are poor and unbalanced and it's the worst of all Zombiesurvivals. If i run around, from place to place over miles, without a car or anything, i could go AFK run and cry myself into a pillow why i actually bought the game. DayZ had good places around, but this is hilarious. But if you got something, nope, you die.

Oh, if you jump 2 feet down, you lose half of your health points, for no reason.

Community

I rather play Call of Duty on XBoX and i don't own one. People tend to kill each other, which is allowed, but they run braindead around and spawncamp with snipers. No fun allowed guys!

End

Yeah, 10/10 would not buy. I wasted 27 US-Dollar back in the day and got my money back, because it's a simple fraud. But to warn you guys, it is the worst game around, the Metascore is a bloodier red than a menstruation. Please guys, don't support trash.

reviewText: If you've already bought this game I'm so sorry. This game is 10 pounds of nope in a five pound bag. Anything that could've  been done wrong, was. The developers must have intentionally looked at every aspect of a good zombie survival game and purposely messed it up. The zombies are no threatening in the slightest, however in order to get into any city you have sprint through HUNDREDS of them. Some of the cities can only be accessed by bridge, where you'll find zombies flowing like ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t from ♥♥♥♥ Cheney's mouth. They lied about content and were temporarily removed from the steam market. They lied about the existence of vehicles. The main threat in the game is players, who will bait you like there's no tomorrow, but eve if you're 20 miles into the middle of nowhere, the map is so small that there's guarunteed to be someone sitting with a sniper rifle watching you at every moment. Back to the cities, if you even manage to get into one there is next to no loot there. I once searched a city for over an hour and found ONE ammo clip on the roof of an apartment building. You'll realize your mistake in buying this game not even 5 minutes after starting it up. There are a series of types of characters you can use, but they are all paid characters except for the absolute worst possible one. If you buy this, Ra help you.

I will never play any other game ever again. 10/10

reviewText:
WARNING DISCLAIMER: VIEWER DISCRETION IS ADVISED - THIS GAME HAS ZOMBIES!

ABOUT THE GAME:

* A Huge Persistent World: This is an (non)linear open world game, where everything looks absolutely the same!

* Explore trees, Scavenge really useless stuff, try to KILL (!!!) Zombies, and die really often!

* In-game money - if you want good stuff you will have to pay silly amounts of money for it!

* You are one of the few survivors and must navigate the desolate and poorly animated countryside exploring cities and scavenging for items that you will never have any use for!

* Group with a surprisingly big number of other players to increase your non-existent chances of survival - experience trees together!

KEY FEATURES:

* Combination of First-Person and Third Person Perspectives - you can choose in which camera angle you want to look at trees and get killed in!

* Meld of PVE (Player versus Environment) and PVP (Player versus Player) - get killed by Zombies or even OTHER players!

* Safe Settlements where Players can access their global inventory - practical for storing your useless loot!

* Trees!

* Create your own Clans - you will possibly avoid boredom even longer!

* Adrenaline pumping activities - run, walk, jump!

* Swimming - animations that would make a senile robot jealous!

* Reputation system – choose to become a lawman or bandit; there is no difference!

* Leave Messages for friends in the game world with a time capsule - tell other players about the trees YOU have seen!

* Immersive environment with unique and spine ch(k)illing sound effects - they will actually scare you with their poor quality!

* Huge variation of melee and firearm weapon types - finding them is impossible!


(Never ever even consider to buy this compilation of low-budget robot animations, pixilated textures, unrealistic moaning sounds and invincible walking corpses - not even on sale!
Seriously, your eyes wil burn, your brain will rot and your ears will bleed by experiencing this kind of low quality.)

reviewText: My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, 'If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately.'. Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me- 'Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through. I agreed. At 28
date: I have never touched a cigarette. I must say
recommended: I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it
hoursPlayed: because this game gave me cancer anyway."

The loot table needs a serious over haul
date: the zombie AI needs some dusting off.  Over all if you are looking for a great way to ♥♥♥♥ away your hard earned money this is for you.  For the majority of you out there that would actually like to be entertained
recommended: RUN! RUN FAR AND RUN FAST!  Normally I would hold off on writting such a horrible review but I can not even begin to fathom why steam would even allow this farce. reviewText:
I've played this game since Alpha.. had around 4,000 hours (non-steam) and let me say a few things:

This game is a good game when it comes to surviving, maybe not one of the best... but when it comes to handling guns, I like it.

Then all the rest of the things about this game is awful. You see hackers even in PRIVATE SERVERS.

The worst part of this game is the Anti-Cheat, got banned because the map glitched and started teleporting me upwards and I hit the skybox, and got disconnected. The next day I got banned for potential nocliping because the map in the middle of nowhere was giving my bugs. I was going under the map (dying from that) and also glitching up the skybox (disconnecting from that)

This game is gone downhill since Alpha, and is even taking a bigger step to becoming one of the shitiest games on Steam.

Extremely dissapointed with the Anti-Cheat system, fix that up if you want to have a chance of getting some proper reviews.

reviewText:
Incredibly good game.
Played for 10 minutes, crashed on attempting to join a server.
Restarted, waited to join a server again. Success! I've gotten in.
It's dark, for some reason my character is glowing yellow and looks like lava.
I have no idea how to get this damn flashlight out of my hands.
I see a house in front of me, I slowly make my way there.
Zombies are spotted. I run into the house. Empty.
I try to run out but the zombies are blocking the doorway and apparently it's impossible to run past them.
I'm dead. Zombies are eating me alive.
Able to respond in 90 seconds. Waits 90 seconds.
I'm taken back to the character screen. You can respond again in 18 minutes. Wow I only have to wait 18 minutes to relive that thrilling 1 minute in the game again? Sweet deal, bro!!
But wait, if I don't want to wait to jump back into the excitement then there is an option to pay to re spawn. Incredible.
Exited the game. Best waste of $1.50 I ever spent.

10/10 Way better than Day-Z.

reviewText:
ugly game do not buy! pie recipe 1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

reviewText:
This game has to be the worst of the worst when it comes to an all around experience. I totalled about 10 hours of ( at times forced) gameplay.
(Graphics) - It has a beautiful landscape I give it that, but is also a FORCED beauty on your machine. The recent updates took away almost all controls over your video/hardware settings and forced all players to run at what the Developers want you to run.  The outcome is an even more terribly optimized experience rendering all low-end pc's ( fps 30 before update, ran great) unoperable. Fps even for high-end users is a 10 fps experience due to lack of extended work.
(Gameplay) - The gameplay varies but is generally just as terrible. The difference from the critically acclaimed DayZ and this { turd taped to a radiator} is that this is heavily influenced by the cash shop. Everything required for long term survival is bought on the cash shop i.e powerful guns/equipment/ammo EVERYTHING. Safe zones are camped, item spawns are not randomized and are also camped. Game time can consist of short survival times due to cashshoppers and the frequent HACKER.
(UI/Community/Support) The maps are big enough, but are suffocating when the server is full. Aside from a couple small settlements and a handful of cities there is NOTHING outside of those areas. Lots of space and very barren unless you love seeing trees. The zombie mechanics are horrible, they run twice as fast as you and apparently have a 10ft reach. The game has glitches left and right and have not been addressed at all. The Developer support is almost nonexistent with little to no cooperation with the community. The weekly updates consist of no major update fixes to glitches and consist of Dev's either saying" they will be doing an update or going on little breaks. There is no major support from the Game Dev's and have not been any in a long time.

I give it a Charlie Brown rating of meh/10. Move along people

reviewText:
I'm not going to lie. This game is a blatant rip-off of DayZ. Yes, it has tried to change. Yes, it does have a lot going for it. In fact, it isn't a bad game - what makes it almost unplayable is the business model set by the game developers.

I'm used to Pay2Win mechanics in F2P games, but Infestation actually is a bought game - yet it requires microtransactions for almost every bit amount of fun in it. Due to this, very few people play it.

In fact, I only encountered one other player and only I could see him. We agreed over the public chat to go our seperate ways and then I never saw a person since.

This game could be good, but only if the developers stop being stupidly greedy.

reviewText: This is one masterpiece you can NOT pass up. This game might have the power to cure cancer, HIV, and possibly amputated limbs. This game also possesses a euphoric effect. If you don't get this game, your chances of getting brain cancer are de- increased by 99.9% and there is a 0% chance that you will be unsatisfied. This game should be the 8th Wonder of the World. I have 4 780 Titans in my computer as well as 2 I7 4770s and 64GB of Ram, 50 Terabytes of hard drive space, and custom liquid nitrogen cooling, but since this game is so well made, and so much effort was put into this game, that I only run it at 20 fps. This game's graphics are so amazing, the scenery so breathtaking, that I had a heart attack 27 times in a row. This game's combat is fast-paced and exilharating. The combat is also realistic and rewarding. I hit a zombie with my metal flashlight in it's face repeatedly for 5 minutes, and when it died I got a fun-sized Milky Way candy bar. It's almost like the apocalypse is really happening! I explored the entire map for 6 hours and I found a slingshot in a police department! This game isn't Game of the Year, this game is Game of the Century. It's amazing combat, beautiful scenery, and realistic loot system, make this the best game I have ever played. I will never play any other game ever again. 10/10

reviewText:
Being able to express the disapointment in a games company in the handling of it's consumer, let alone the targets it promised yet failed to reach, is now shrouded in fear of being banned, cautioned or even having legal material on your YouTube channel flagged for Copyright Infringement. Hammerpoint Interactive aren't strangers to controversy and to this day continue to be the most unprofessional games company i have ever witnessed, in context of dealing with customers as well as the media them selves. I wrote an article on my ordeal with Hammerpoint Interactive and this game in particular that managed to go viral, thanks to the Steam and gaming community in general and also bumped the traffic and support towards the YouTube channel my self and my friends started. Hammerpoint Interactive created a streisand effect trying to silence a small YouTube channel, that had 11 followers and instead AGAIN expressed to the general public how childish they can be when it comes to criticism of their below par, fraudulent product...the history of them selve's with Steam is enough to example that.

If they left my video alone and had it sit there in it's purely legal state that it was, i'd recommend this game, but because they don't take criticism of their product in a proffesional manner and don't act like a serious company towards their consumers even when the DEV's of the company are caught explotiting the game on live streams, destroying their customers enjoyment of the game to which they then ban the users on forums for outing them (as they rightly should), then i wouldn't...ever. Nah guys, what you say is not right, no no no!

I and a friend, have been camped in a PTE server at the motel roof in caliwood near the beach. We have been on the lookout for players until all of a sudden he died after 3 hits to the head from a player whose nick was about enough insulting. Then, I jumped up behind a barricade, and almost immediately I received few hits to the head and also died instantly, even though we both had full stuff gear and snipers on us, we died easy peasy. My friend then logged in on another character and also died instantly. In a while, we joined again, geared fully with snipers to hunt that player down. We went up on that roof and saw that player somewhat 200-300 meters in front of us and I stuck my head out to aim him with my magnum, and then I received 3 hits from him and died before I even noticed my health going down which was a surprise because I had a full skill tree. My friend, also died the same way have I.

reviewText: I got this game back in 2012, i was one of the few who actually pre-ordered it. I never stopped playing it since back then. I loved this game. I loved how it fused PVP & survival together. No survival game was able to create such great PVP, not even DayZ. However since the original developers left the game back in january the game left with them. The new company has released 1 patch since then and they're working on a new Infestation" that will probably be a dissapointment aswell. It really sucks that i can't have back the awesome times back i had in 2013 with this game. Now only campers & hackers play this game. It's horrible. Most of my friends also left this game. So if you want a good Survival game

reviewText:
I was permanently banned from this game for no reason, just like 100s of other customers.  I didn't expect much from this game, but I figured I'd give it a try anyway.  After playing less than a minute when I purchased and closing it, I decided to have a go at it today after about 2 months and was informed by the launcher I was permanently banned.

I'm currently waiting on their canned customer support ticket reponse that they've found evidence of multiple cheats used in game but they cannot tell me what, why or when and not to contact them again about the matter.

I have absolutely NO idea why Steam continues to sell this game, expecially after forcing it off the marketplace for over a month after the developers deliberately lied and misled their customers at that time.

Save yourself the headache and just buy DayZ Standalone.  A game that actually deserves your money, not this garbage which charges you to buy items in game after you've already purchased it.

reviewText:
What was once a great game, has fallen prey to lackluster development and more recently, despite this having been an issue from the get-go, it's horrendously monitored servers see a laughable number of user injected mods; giving cheating players a cruel and gamebreaking unfair advantage.

Oh right, and literally everyone is a ♥♥♥♥ [Still, not as bad as the Day-Z], It's almost comically PTW - Ammunition is 400% [probably not exaggerating] easier to obtain via in-game microtransactions than it is to loot in-game. Decent armours and guns are a must-have, and although these can be obtained in-game, you are unlikely to survive as far as obtaining some unless you've already paid for the equivilant via microtransactions.

Loved this game with friends, long before i returned alone; to log on with each of my characters and get instantly killed by cheating players injecting the ♥♥♥♥ out of the servers.

Do i recommend this game? Not anymore... and any enjoyment i received from this game was from playing with friends when realistically we could all have better spent our time elsewhere.

♥♥♥♥ing awful game, i feel the dev's owe me not only 108 hours of my life; but any money i poured into this to have wasted by cheating players on their god awful ♥♥♥♥♥torms of servers.

My Rating -12 / 1 000 000. [I'm being ♥♥♥♥ing generous, don't buy this piece of ♥♥♥♥]

reviewText:
Greetings,
First of all, I'd like to say that I enjoyed playing the game a lot during its prime time. I have had great time with my friends exploring and fighting the zombie hordes for the first time.

I wish I could say the same for the rest of my experience, the game had great potential, I can say had because it is beyond repair, the game is run by Hammerpoint Interactive, just about the worst company in existance.

Examples, crashes every 5 minutes, just an array of graphical issues, pc compatibility issues... what can I say, Alienware pc's can't run the game above 20 fps.... for todays standards ugly graphics, and oh, the cream on top, an absolute swarm of hackers, just about the only game where every single server is swarmed by hackers, I'm not talking about 1 or 2, 90% of servers current population is hacking, this is a fact.
Anti cheat system there is simply for looks and that's pretty much that.

To keep the story short, the game's head developer at the current time, the community manager, calls players doorknobs for trying to prevent the game becoming pay2win, one of the more polite words we have heard from the community manager.

Absolute 0 communication with the player base, 0 bug fixes, there are bugs that first appeared in alpha that haven't been fixed, a whole year and some months ago gone by, company cares only about money. 0 customer support, people bought  in game currency for real money and never got what they paid for.

In short, the absolute worst game of my life, sure it had some bright moments, but if you want to avoid getting cancer, don't buy this game ever.

If this game was free to play I wouldn't recommend it.

reviewText: I reckon this game could possibly be Satan incarnate. I thought at the sight of the sale 'Oh it's only £1, It'll be funny to pay little for a TOTALLY GREAT game' So I bought it and for the first twenty minutes it physically would not launch. But I persisted, I installed the game after a TOTALLY SHORT amount of time and began to play...Wait - wait no that didn't happen. I didn't play. I spent another REALLY SHORT amount of time installing the game again and then it finally launched. I just had enough time to play the game for about 30 minutes and submit this review before I clawed my eyes out and shot myself in the face with a 12 gauge Double Barreled shotgun, WHICH ACCORDING TO THIS GAME ONLY HAS ONE BULLET. Get DayZ. DayZ won't give you mental Herpes. All in all honesty I think Hammerpoint should pay you to install the game.

reviewText: Horrible horrible horrible horrid game. A straight up cash-grab so much promised so much left unfulffilled. The concept of the game is great don't get me wrong an open-world zombie exploration multiplayer survival, what could go wrong? Alot, and alot did. The game has been poorly optimized since day 1 challenging the greatest of graphics cards with poorly rendered areas and straight up disrespect to optimizaiton. Hacking albeit progress has been made is still a major issue with the devs struggling to keep their software and systems up to date with the latest releases. One of the key elements of the game is the ability to group up and share the expierience with your friends. However this becomes more of a challenge than the zombies themselves with huge amounts of map to cover with relatively little supplies and the constant threats of the world. The game is just out-matched in its market with the Day-Z standalone just recently released I'd reccomend to anyone to spring for that it is worth the extra money then what you'd be getting with this cash-grab.

reviewText:
I really didnt want to write this. I gave this game a second chance, i just tried to log in, mistyped my password 2 times and got banned for 1 hour? So here i come. It's a bit late for this review but... Nevermind.

I still cannot believe that i was so hyped for this game. Me and my friends bought this ♥♥♥♥ for playing together.  We wanted to have fun. WRONG! Everything went wrong. First of all, for the creators of this game, nice job, really ♥♥♥♥ing nice. THEY PROMISED FOR LOTS OF THINGS AND NONE CAME TO REALITY! I started playing this game when it was still in Alpha. I bought the second package for it. The game wasnt so bad in the first days. Except the ghost zombie bug, that was awful. Me and 4 friends of mine were searching for supplies and weapons for days. What? WOW WE FOUND A SHOTGUN!!! But the game creators didnt want us to have some ammo.  Oh, now we are starving? Doesnt matter, we will just go and die slowly. Alright enough with the Alpha and Beta ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t.

And the game was released. I wanted do try this game again. I entered the game and... Nothing changed? Oh okay, let me wander a little bit and BAM, a big hole in my head. This is normal.

Months later me and my friends wanted to play this again. We found a low populated server and joined it. We found some equipment and wanted to wander together. Somehow everyone left the server. There were 2 people in the server except us. And what happened? When we were raiding the city, someguy flied near us, and quickscoped" everyone in 2 seconds. Well flying + killing 4 people in 2 seconds
hoursPlayed: Steam has enough mercy to give this game 20/100\n\nI would give didiwritethisreviewforthis♥♥♥♥♥♥game/100"
voteText: November 3, 2014

reviewText: You know, at first. This really isn't a bad game. But once you spend 50+ dollars trying too support the game and help development you get banned for NO REASON. I was banned twice. The first time we wroked things out and I was back to playing the game, then they banned me a second time. I sent a ticket in and waited for a response.... 2 months later I finally recieve a response, they say they have proof of hacking on my account but they cannot provide it... I even gave them permission too search my computer for any hacks. It's sad really, the moderators and admins they PAY don't do their job on the forum, which is why I spent THREE HOURS A DAY helping people with bug fixes, unlike the Professional" Admin and mod team. DO NOT BUY THIS GAME unless you want to be backstabbed by hammerpoint."

reviewText:
Ok, i am going to offer and honest view in this review and make sure everyone is completley aware of the positives and negatives. Firstly, i think the game is amazing, fun to play and the best of its kind out at the moment. Gameplay is awesome, the shere anxiety you fell in sintuations as amazing. There is nothing like it. Picture this:

You are approaching a town through a grassy forest at night. You can hear an owl from the tree above and lonelyness sets in. All you have is your flashlight and a few scraps of food. You are wounded and bleeding from a previous encounter with an infected and need to scavange a bandage as fast as you can or you are going to bleed to death. In the near distance, you can see the small town. The moonlight shimmers a slight reflection on the town roads allowing you to barely make out dark figures scattered around. You notice an ambulance led on its side. An aftermath caused by the sudden panic upon outbreak. You move toward it steadily, checking your surroundings for threats. Suddenly ahead of you, a flash of light and the sound of a gunshot follows. You hit the deck, concealed by the long grass listening, wondering if that shot was meant for you.

HOWEVER, yes, i know. My reccomendation is a NO. This is why.
When the game was released it was released titled WARZ and during the early stages, there were no anti-cheat software. Bearing in mind that you could BUY items from the in game store for REAL MONEY. Anyone who bought items with their hard earned cash was quickly robbed of it buy cheaters. At one point i read that there was a FREE cheat software available for the game. IU liked the site in the forum to the developers. Nothing came of it. Cheaters accounts were banned. So all that they had to do to play again was buy the game, create a new account and they were back on their way to stealing items. The devs could have issued an IP ban, but that has never happened.

Constant crash issues, files miraculousy go missing. PB failiures, random kicks from PB communication errors.

DEVS are money grabbers, There was once a time when loot was fairly balanced, fair ammount of guns/backpacks/meds etc. Before the trading was available, they severly nerfed the loot spawns, forcing players to spend money in their store. A lot of items in the store were only available for purchase with GC (in game money purchased with real money). So the more you spent the more you won (unless a hacker got you first)

This game has been avaiable a very long time. And only recently have they added vehicles. again, i kept crashing at one point upon entry. There is 1 map and 1 map only. the new map has been in development for 6 months. You can play in a PTE. The map has a city and 4 TINY towns. The rest of the gigantic map is baron lands which has no actual use.

THis is only a tiny portion of why you should NEVER buy this game. I could write PAGES and PAGES of negatives. In a nutshell, if this game was ran by devs who actually gave a crap about the community and were not trying to bleed them dry i would have been one of the best games of all time. Shame on you DEVS. You ♥♥♥♥ed it up. Good on you

reviewText:
I bought this game for the 50 dollars or whatever it was when it first came out and everyone ♥♥♥♥♥ed about how it was a ripoff of Day-Z.

I first thought it was pretty fun; the concepts were cool, and so was the environment - albeit the game was still mostly under construction back then. I didn't play the game for about a year and just decided to do so now. Nothing has changed except the main screen.

New maps? No. The same good old Colorado".
New weapons? Not really.
Vehicles
recommended:
no.
Ability to actually find a player and not run around by yourself the whole game like in Arma 3? Nope.
New zombies? Nope.
Ability to go into more buildings? Nope.

Should you buy this game? Nope.

I also have a Velocity Micro gaming PC
hoursPlayed: and even when running the game on Ultra uber graphics mode it still doesn't even come close to the graphics shown in the Steam preview pics. My guess is they are touched up lies.\n\nI'm actually pretty offended that I bought it for 50 dollars and now its only 5 dollars. I want my 45 dollar refund damn it. It's my money and I want it now."

reviewText: This game is probably the worst and most frustrating game I have ever played. It has so many problems, hackers end your fun and take your hard earned gear. I have a graphics card that can run high detailed games fine, but the graphics on this game are so terrible and can cause FPS issues. What really makes me dislike the game is that players can simply buy their way into surviving and have all this gear they never even found. But no, it gets worse. Ammo is appearently very rare in the game, being 3x harder to find than actual guns! The guns seem to deal low damage to both zombies and players, which in this case, need more ammo. Where can you get this ammo? You can get it via purchase. I didn't realize that it takes 3 shots with a shotgun to kill a SINGLE zombie. The delevopers pretty much made the guns weak so that they would need more ammo, more ammo that people have to buy in order to get enough to for 1 emergency. This game has an endless amount of problems and issues that im not going to get started on. The only thing I like about this game is how the loot is placed around the map (hat on a dresser, gun in a gun rack, etc.) and more of the buildings are enterable. But aside from only 2 things I thought was well done, I don't recommend this game. I recommend titles such as DayZ, Rust, and State of Decay if your looking for a good zombie apocolyptic survival game.

reviewText:
This is a great example of what could have been. Post apocalyptic zombie survival mmo sounds hard to mess up but nearly every one does and this game takes the cake and eats the ♥♥♥♥ out of it. When first released on steam as War It had pictures of the game looking fun, playable, and looking polished with features. Sadly they were all fake all these features were not even included and still are not. They stole pictures and loading screens from other games and was forced to take them down along with the whole game its self for awhile on steam. It doesn't stop there the developers made acounts went in game and banned people talking ♥♥♥♥ about the game. About the only thing worse then the developers is the actual community its self. Camping outside one of the 3 safe zones with wepons killing new players that only have flashlights for no reason. I guess I should mention the gameplay as well. Gun combat is shakey, inaccurate, and almost useless unless you have a scope. Most of you would be lucky to even get far enough to find a gun. Cause once you get killed by an other player for no reason you get to waitover an hour of real life to respawn! That is unless you pay to them real life money to respawn faster of course!. Melee combat is almost useless as hits do not register. Most items are locked behind a pay 2 win wall. I could go on for hours about just my horror stories in this game. Maybe I will write more just to keep you from buying this game from these greedy lying ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s.

Final Score
3/10

reviewText: Honestly this is the worst zombie MMO I have played. At first it looked very interesting, but it was just a terrible copy of DayZ and other similar games. I'm quite sure there was a reason this game was about 1$ during a Steam sale, and yet even though it was only a dollar I still wish to refund it. When I first bought the game, downloaded it, then played it, I was suddenly thrown into the main menu having no idea what to do. There is no tutorial whatsoever, and you're not going to recieve any help from other players. When I first entered a server I spawned right next to a man with an AK-47. Instantly I tried to ask for some assistance and tips. Same goes for all the other servers. It's always shoot first then talk for some reason. This game is certainly not friendly to new players, nor is the community very friendly either. To finish off, I HIGHLY dislike this game and hope that no one else will buy it.

reviewText: Infestaion Survivor Stories tries to capture the new Zombie MMO genre but fails due to many flaws with the game.\n\nThe most notable flaw is the microtransactions which takes away the whole survival" from the game knowing that you can buy food and medical supplies that does give an unfair advantage to players who chose not to pay for virtual items

recommended: Zombies can seem to hit you when they are not very close to you and it doesn't take long for them to kill you. If you try to stand on hard to reach places the zombies sometimes stack on each other and can eventually hit you.\n\nA big flaw in the game is how the zombies match your running speed
hoursPlayed: This matched with the fact you walk slower the more damaged you are
voteText: But the zombies seem to keep jogging on so it becomes very hard to outrun them this matched with their hit range makes the game too hard and almost unplayable.\n\nAll this negativity doesn't mean the game doesn't have some positve atributes

reviewText:
Honestly I played this game for a long time, and for many hours a day, and while I can honestly say I enjoyed playing it for a while, my final conclusion is that this genre of gaming is the next big thing in MMO, and this idea for a game is fantastic.

That being said this particular game is a case of what could potentially be an absolutely outstanding game, being held back by it's lazy and carefree developers.

The game as you will find is riddled with glitches, bugs, poor balancing issues, and not to mention least of all hackers.

Know in any other gamers hackers a real nuisciance but in this there level of annoyance and anger they inflict upon you is so much worse, because you loose all your hard earned guns and items and have to just start from scratch yet again and after being killed 15 times in a row from 500 + metres by an aimbot the game becomes infuiriating.

All I can say is I hope a game along this genre line is launched soon that is properly handled and produced by the developers.

reviewText: The game itself I've heard very bad things about, and even didn't realize it was WarZ just renamed. The controls are choppy and the damage you can do vs the zombiesis disheartening. However gameplay problems aside thats not the reason why I don't recomend this game, its the customer support and the way they deal with players. Given that games through steam, especially ones that require an account, can't be changed once initialy set. This makes it impossible to play the game if anything happens.  If you look on my record, you can see that I have barely any time on this game, that is due to the way the game works. If you die, theres a 24 hour cooldown before you can play again. Its fine I'll play a little bit, and if I die turn the game off. After getting the 7 or so hours of total play time, I was tired of playing. I uninstalled it and went on to play other games.\n\nMonths later, I see the new update and decide to play it again to see if anything was made better. And to my surprise I find that my account is banned. Why was it banned? I haven't played the game at all. I decide to contact customer support about the problem, perhaps they can shed some light on what happened or what they mistakenly think happened in game. January 10th was when I sent them a support ticket to repeal the ban, they only just got back to me today saying there was detected uses of exploits or programs to basically cheat the game. And that because this so called detection was against their agreement they won't unban the account. Now remember I haven't played the game at all in this entire time they say something happened. So how could I have suposedly done any of this? Their answer? We are unable to provide any further detail regarding the results of our investigations due to its sensitive nature." So the information about my account is sensitive and unable to be shared with me
date: the account owner. They won't overturn the decision cuz it aparently is against their terms even if it may be their mistake in the first place

reviewText: War Z, or Infestation: Survivor Stories as it has been forcibly renamed (not the devs fault but the new name just isn't catchy), had the potential to be an excellent survival game, it just needed a few major issues such as its cheat protection and banning system ironed out. However, the developers made a mess of it, instead focusing on adding more and more content and complicating things by constantly changing loot spawning rates and postions, making it impossible to actually set up with a group of friends in one location. By failing to address the needs and requests of the community, they allowed this game to flop and become a sore point for any self-respecting survival player. Anyone looking to purchase a survival game, avoid this one, if you're set on a zombie survival game get Day-Z or, for an interesting twist, Nether, though as for the latter there is again the worry that it could also follow the same path as ISS did.

reviewText:
I won’t go into detail about the bad gameplay animation, the textures or the horrible player interaction that most people tend to talk about in this renamed pile of something that makes even worst crap look as clean as a new polished mirror.
It’s really how the trading system works that bothers me even after taking my £13.00 purchasing the game it dares have the option to put more money if I wanted better starting item’s  to only have the possibility of losing them if I die, I could understand if the item’s stayed in there storage permanently like an infinite number since access to them is only available in traders or when creating a new character, but because it doesn’t it’s like taking a gamble with no real payoff (put it simply an actual real waste of money).

There’s also the fact you can’t sell off any of the loot you find like weapons or armour meaning the only way to get in game currency is to just continuously kill zombies which leads to endless grinding due to it being fairly rare that they drop only 10-50 dollars.

If anything I’m the Idiot for buying this, I don’t know why I didn’t take the advice from half the reviews demoting this low rated game.

reviewText: Is this game good? No. Do I reccomend it? No. Is it fun to play and screw around and play with friends? Yes. You can occasionaly find weapons and ammo around the map which is fun to do. You can explore the crappy looking terraign, you can walk into every single town/airport and die instantly by invisible zombies, or hordes of hundreds of them in a two house town. If you have a big group of people, you can really ♥♥♥♥ other people off. Only get this game if its Free-To-Play. Don't pay your precious money. There are much better, cheaper games than this. If you're going to invest money in a zombie open-world survival game, buy the standalone DayZ. It's in alpha(I am writing this December 30th of 2013) and it is very buggy, but with a game that made 5.1 million dollars in one day, the developers have no choice but to shell it out, take their time, and make it good. I got this game for free though, so I didn't spend a cent. Don't get this game unless you just pooped out 500 million dollars. Even then, buy the game with caution.

reviewText:
I won’t go into detail about the bad gameplay animation, the textures or the horrible player interaction that most people tend to talk about in this renamed pile of something that makes even worst crap look as clean as a new polished mirror.
It’s really how the trading system works that bothers me even after taking my £13.00 purchasing the game it dares have the option to put more money if I wanted better starting item’s  to only have the possibility of losing them if I die, I could understand if the item’s stayed in there storage permanently like an infinite number since access to them is only available in traders or when creating a new character, but because it doesn’t it’s like taking a gamble with no real payoff (put it simply an actual real waste of money).

There’s also the fact you can’t sell off any of the loot you find like weapons or armour meaning the only way to get in game currency is to just continuously kill zombies which leads to endless grinding due to it being fairly rare that they drop only 10-50 dollars.

If anything I’m the Idiot for buying this, I don’t know why I didn’t take the advice from half the reviews demoting this low rated game.

reviewText:
Before I say how horrible this game is, let me provide the source of my anger in this game. I decided to go into a zombie infested military base in hopes of finding at the very least a pistol. I had plenty of ammunition. Without realizing it, I spent 2 hours searching that enitre base, hacking my way through an endless amount of zombies, with way too many close calls only to realize that there is no gun in that base. Of all places to find a gun, you would think a military base would have it. But nope. I even searched Police stations, nothing. Now to stop myself from rambeling, I am just going to list what is wrong with this game.
-Zombies run like they have some sort of strange disease that doesn't just bring them back to life.
-Guns are almost impossible to find, yet some people have them by what seems to be a miracle.
-You cannot trust anyone, if you group with someone you can expect 9 times out of 10, they will kill you.
- You will spend hours just searching ONE military base, thankfully I called it quits after realizing I had just spent 2 hours.
- Animation horrible
- Server Crashes
- the ressurection system is unfair
- insufficient customization options
- lag lag lag lag lag lag lag lag lag oh did i mention? LAG
- NOT EVEN A DEAD ZOMBIE SOLDIER HAD A DAMN PISTOL
- ammo everywhere, no gun in sight.
- you lose everything when you die.... including the points you just bought with REAL money.
- Flare gun..... What is the point if everyone is going to kill you.
- There needs to be a better friend/foe system.
- Better travel system needed
- It is the 21st century in this game SOMEONE HAS TO HAVE A DAMN GUN.
My Rant is over.....

reviewText: I wake up a foot or two above the ground. As I land, the world around me starts to become clear. Trees have taken over the world. I wander throughout the day with my flashlight on, until I come across what appears to be a large amount of zombies surrounding a random spot in the road where everyone has decided to park their cars and leave. I approach with caution. I run up and jump onto the back of a truck. That's when I find myself a delicious candy bar. I enjoy this sweet piece of tastiness. Then the zombies learn to climb. I bash their skulls in with my flashlight with ease. I pick up a rifle to pick off the rest. Little did I know, it had no bullets. Gun is useless. Zombies are now entirely surrounding me. I spend the next half hour breaking the heads of the zombies with my extremely durable flashlight until the coast is clear. I make a run for it. I find a farm, but unfortunately, it is filled with nothing but duct tape. I also found a glow stick, but alas, my small kindergarden backpack could not carry any more, as it was filled with tape. That's when I set out to find a home for the night. I search effortlessly, when I finally see a city. It is very close, I start to run. Suddenly, zombies start teleporting to my location. What do I do? Kill them with my flashlight. Oh no! My flashlight no longer hits where I tell it to! I swing but no matter how many times the light makes contact with the zombie, it continues to brush right through it! I am forced to run. I run to the city, finally safe. I find a revolver on the ground, good. Now I can survive better. Wait! No I can't! Sniped. My journey had ended. As I die, all of my duct tape falls out onto the ground. Then... Oh man... Then I was forced... To... Wait around 20 minutes. OR PAY TO REVIVE NOW! :D\n\nI recommend this game to anyone who loves crying and spending $20 on digital glow sticks!

reviewText:
Usually, the Metascore of a game isn't accurate. I can say the same for this time aswell.

The fact that this game has a 20 in the Metascore is giving the developers too much credit.

This game was not even remotely worth the $1.49 it was on sale for. They should pay YOU to play this game. This game is garbage and a half. I would get into more detail, but after 30 minutes of this game, I can tell you that the AI might aswell had been by the developers of Big Rigs. The only reason this game was ever scraped together from Hammerpoint Interactive was to vampire off of the success of DayZ, and they did perfectly at just that. They made their game War Inc, except with different models and added zombies, they couldn't even make their own ToS. They deliberately took League of Legend's ToS and made it their own, just finding and replacing Riot's name to their own. The only thing this game and the developers did well, was steal the money of zombie game enthusiasts and bite the hand that feeds these low-life cretins.

The load times and the amount of cheaters on the game are nothing compared to any other game I've played, including World at War on console.

reviewText:
First, a warning: The developers of this game will bend you over and f*ck you, hard and deep. They are the worst kind of scumbags on the internet.

Originally titled The War Z, Infestation: Survivor Stories has some very innovative perspectives on survival FPS's. Akin to DayZ, it's vast open world full of zombies and loot allow for hours of gameplay. But, unlike DayZ I:SS offers a unique EXP system and persistent inventory comparable to the stash system from Diablo or PoE. But all of this is for naught, as the EXP is just that, an accumulation of EXP with nothing to spend it on, and the persistant inventory/stash would be GREAT, if not for the horrible lacking of items to find and the Pay to Win MTM.

The game intentionally tries to make you less than self sufficient, forcing you to either buy from the MTM, starve to death, die of Dehydration, or have almost no ammo, ever. Guns are also scarce beyond everything you'd ever imagine. If you find a shotgun, good luck finding ammo for it, and STANAG's are more rare than Sniper Rifles.

So be warned, this game is full of empty promises, corruption, and greed.

Update: I returned to this game after an 8 month hiatus, and alot has been fixed. Many of the stability issues have been fixed, the spawn rate of items is acceptable (but certainly not lucrative), the skill tree has finally been implemented, vehicles have been added and missions have improved the rate in which you accumulate in-game currency you can spend at settlements. Also, the in game currency feels much more reasonable to spend to get items.

Update 12/14/14: This game has inherent flaws in the combat mechanics, there's a massive hole in the anti-cheat system making the game vulnerable to cheaters, the spawn system could use some improvement, and stability issues plague this game. The recent patch has really done a service to this game by removing the revive timer. All in all, though I:SS can be fun to play, it's still not a game I'd recommend.

TL;DR (12/14/14): NOT RECOMMENDED

reviewText: So I decided to make a review for Infestation: Survivor Stories after I opened up the game for the first time in a week and got a message that said You have been banned permanetly by fairfight". Now I dont remember me hacking or anything but I do remember right now that im about to give a horrible review for this copy of "war inc" ♥♥♥♥. I guess they could tell the future to know that I am about to write a long
hoursPlayed:
HONEST isn't the word they're looking for about this game.

So where do I start? Well I will just start from the beginning.

So here I am loading into the world of colorado for the first time. My DayZ expectations up and my Call Of Duty expectations down to the minimum but let me tell you....I should have flipped those two around. I ran for 10 minutes until I met this little base. I checked my map and it said..."Norad Military Base". So I ran in there and I saw a zombie. I had courage with my flashlight gripped in my hand and immedatly walked towards the zombie...All of the sudden I heard ♥♥♥♥♥♥ audio moaning from all directions. I sprinted down into the middle of the base and then I heard a huge BANG..."You are dead" it said as it played sad music. That wasn't the first time I got shot out of the blue at will NEVER be its last. After 100 hours of pain and suffering I got a good inventory. I found a clan and we PvP'd all day. We got loads of loot..LOADS OF IT. But then later something stranged happened....at blue ridge safe zone I saw 2 guys doing something with guns. There were only 10 people on the server including me so I ran to get closer and they looked like they were dooping snipers. At first I though that was dumb and stupid but I look now at it and see that hacking was everywhere. 80% off all infestation players are Hackers. So the zombie AI is rigged

reviewText:
Myself and a few of my mates love this game...but we are forced to play on a private server cuz of the ridiculous PvP side of the 'game'.
its a shame the PvP is such a massive asspect of a so called survival game that expects you to survive a ZOMBIE appocolyps, not an onslaught of 5 year old hackers with micro transaction fever and rucksacks full of ammo.... BTW, this mite be an old rant for some of you (if it is, dont troll a sarcy reply, youll just show how much of a nub you are) but i cant understand why a game with such huge potential cant give an option to be or not to be part of the mindelss PvP side. spawn...dead....another flashlight looted (awesome fun -_- ), i understand for some players thats all they can cope with...but if thats what their mental capacity wants, then why dont they go and kick some in Planet side 2 or something designed around full PvP. forcing it into a survival game and allowing sooo much of the game to be ignored, must be either be a brilliant idea building up to something gamechanging by the devs or else they realy dont give a damn and are just in it for the money from these gankers who micro trans shed loads of ammo (like i said earlier)....either way. GIVE US A CHANCE TO PLAY THE GAME BY OPTING OUT OF THE PVP is the main shout about this game.
It is a good game, and a private server deffinatly pays of if PvP is not your thang. Does need alot of work still as a game. but stick with it. Im sure the Devs will listn to what the people want soon enough.
And Hackers..those souless, friendless, idiotic mindless sad celler dwelling game wreking ♥♥♥♥♥s need to get out more and stop making other people suffer for their own insufferable empty lives.

*takes a bow and thanks you all :)

reviewText:
メタスコアがまさかの数値を叩き出していますが、ゲーム自体はやってることがDayZなのでつまらないものではありません。
人によってはDayZというかArmAシリーズのもったりした操作性が嫌いな人もいるので、そういう人ならむしろこっちの方が合うのではないかと。
このゲームの評価が低い大きな理由は開発・運営会社が非常にいい加減かつ口八丁なことで、大風呂敷広げておいて結局殆ど実現できていないという点でしょう。
またチート対策などもあまり積極的ではない感じで、ゲームが崩壊していることもしばしば。
あと単純にゲームのつくりが適当というか急ごしらえな感じがしますね、エンジンが無料ゲームのWar inc.と一緒なのですが殆どのモーションやオブジェクトは使いまわしとなっています。
開発・運営面を加味しなかった場合個人的にはメタスコア50以上はあるんじゃないかと思っていたり。

reviewText: Contrary to what many others have said, I confirm that you can still indeed login to Infestation, and that its various official servers are still online. reviewText:
Alright, I decided to review this after owning it for months now.  I know Steam says I only have roughly 1 hour played on this game, but I originally bought it from their website after it was released.  So, here's my review for 'Infestation: Survivor Stories' (Originally known as 'WarZ').

Performance : Most of my friends on Steam know that I have a superb gaming PC, which I bought for roughly $2,000. It's GPU (graphics processing unit) is amazing, and etc. Despite my PC's specs, I somehow average at roughly 15 frames per second on  low  settings. Did they create the game so it works better for specific graphics cards or something? If they did, that's really idiotic on the developer's part.

Graphics : Personally, I don't judge a game by it's graphics... but there are some people out there who do. The game's graphics looks like a game out of 2008, and isn't detailed that well.

Combat & AI: The combat of 'Infestation: Survival Stories' has always given me a huge headache, even when I have a superb weapon. Whether I'm using a combat knife or an axe, I find it taking absolutely  forever  to kill one zombie... while hitting it's head. The combat is really buggy as well, from my experiences playing the game. The AI of the zombies is less than decent as well, but they're zombies... so it's not like they're  supposed  to be smart.

Community : The community of the game is fairly nice, although there is one thing to be aware of before buying this game.  Do not trust anyone.  Usually that's the case for most zombie MMO's out there, but there are friendly people... right? Not in 'Infestation: Survival Stories'! Any player I've come across in this game has either killed me or attempted to kill me and died in the process. I'm sure there may be a few people playing a hero here and there, but none that I've come across so far. Another problem of this game is that  alot  of people hack in this game. So, if you're going to fight someone... it may not always be a fair fight.

Servers : I personally haven't had many connection issues with the servers in 'Infestation: Survival Stories', but like most game there are a few connections issues here and there.  Although, you should expect to be banned on servers in this game... alot.  Even if you aren't doing anything, you could possibly get banned from the server you're playing on. I've been banned constantly off of servers for hacking when I've done nothing.

Is this game 'P2W'? : When people say this game is P2W (pay to win), they are completely right. This game is extremely P2W, as you can buy almost any item from the game with real money, instead of finding it in the game.

My overall rating of the game is 4/10.  It has it's moments, but it can be frustrating as all hell.

So, this concludes my review of 'Infestation: Survival Stories' ('WarZ'). I hope you found this review helpful, and if you didn't, feel free to comment why! And lastly, thanks for reading my review. =)

Ho! almost forget, in this game the zombies run as fast as you, it is impossible to escape runing, and you wil die if anyone note you and you dont have a gun and lots of ammo, any weapon other than a gun is quite useless, it takes several zilion hits to kill a zombie, you have to wait 30 min. to play again if you die, and you die a lot in this game. the worst thing is the lack of cooperation between the players, camping all day in a building waiting for other players to pass, and kill every player for the sake of f@#% the game of someone is not my ideia of fun. separate areas for PvP would solve the problem, but the developers don't demonstrate interest in this ideia, and the game is PAY TO WIN.

RUN FROM THIS ♥♥♥♥ LIKE YOU ARE RUNNING FROM A ZOMBIE.

CRAP GAME. Exist other games ( Good games) to invest your spare time.

reviewText:
This game is Madness.
If you do not mind being hunted by everything alive and dead in an online world with nothing but a granola bar, a small backpack, and a flashlight, it will test your mental toughness as it does all it can to eliminate you.
It will spawn you in places that will kill you before you enter the game only to witness your precious inventory fall around your corpse BEFORE you get the ability to control your character !!!
Being online adds the threat of all powerful all seeing all knowing hacking cheaters that wipe out entire servers of all fair non-cheating players just to have the deaths credited to their character's rating.
And Beware and be warned : THERE WILL BE UPDATES !!!   Updates that are GUARANTEED to make the game even more difficult to play, removing the few great features they accidently let slide in and replacing them with useless quirks that frustrate you and leave you wondering just WTF are these Devs thinking ???   And all this while playing through multiple disconnections at every attempt to play through the game for any length of time.  But if you are OK with all of that, are up to  a challenge, and are used to pain and suffering .. WELCOME TO INFESTATION SURVIVOR STORIES !!!

Ah, who said life is easy anyway ?

reviewText:
Hey I am Black Lotus from the WarZ forum (ISS) now Yes I have over 8500 post there. I was recent ip banned from forum now with my new find freedom. I can finally express my true thought without restriction. After a year of playing this game, I feel I would like to express my through for the game.

First off I love this game. This game could be so much fun if the developer would actually listen to me. I truly wanted this game to success. I truly do love this game. I personally spend over 100 dollar in this game. I have brought over 6 accounts and I have no regret what so ever in buying this game. This is game can exciting and rage inducing game. This game has a high risk factor which can make or break you. I personally find that there are a lot good people who play this game. I also know some of them will can also stab you in the back.

One of my most negative experiences was that I find out that the dev and mods were talk crap about other player. Yes some of the people in the community are annoying but it not needs to talk crap about them. The incident with Mad Max aka Striker Cade and a new developer Artemis knives is a fine example of this. I have heard of from a ex Moderator that the dev were talking negative thing about their playerbase and daily too. It a shame this company lack of professionism to it playerbase. I have keep silent about many incident. However now that I have nothing else left. I am going to say this. They clearly didn't expect for the game to do so well. The dev have no faith in it fanbase on it forum community. I even find out that both Kewk and Zombert have talk crap about me too. ( i know you read my personal PMs too) However my love for this game have kept me silent and I do wish this game to be as big as League of Legend or even DOTA. However the dev lack of respect and faith on their community will be it downfall.

I have seen multiple their fans actually tired to help make this game better. However the direction of the developer of OP production was very misleading. They have promise multiple time they will fix the issue and many time they never even try to fix the problem. Look at unstable server continue disconnection from server. There are many bugs and buggy zombie. I understand you have a small team but it over a year. we have waited over for a year for stronghold. It nothing but a death arena. I have remain positive this whole time however I am not going to sit by and watch something I care about died with a fight .
I even play legit all this time. I never even cheated once in this game and I will never cheat in this game. I have been kill so many time that by hacker and I stop caring about it. I have stop caring about them now as this is a never ending battle. Yeah the dev have step up their anti cheat. Yeah Fairfight is a good anti cheat system . However this undermine by the cheap account situation. i know dev you are in need of money. This revolving door policy is not good in the long run. I know they have HWID ip banned. I have seen it in action . It can be very effective however they do not use it. Yeah it a revolving door policy.
I know it long but bear with me.

Support I know support is nonexistence until this year . Yeah I have sent ticket too. None were answer until this year by a real person. They close all my ticket from last year and never solve any of them.
However I admit support now is a alot better and there is no more automated closed response and it a good start from there. Yes if you hacked they know and they do check ip too. So you cannot send a ticket for your friend.

I even got a warning point for reporting a duper who was c-mag and was streaming it too. Yes Kewk give a warning point and I never report a duper until he quited. I give public posting about them and warn you about them. I personally took that too heart. Do you know why now there is a black market and why you are losing money now. I have warned you that duper existed. They are even showing it the public and it so easy to find it too. You can hide on your forum but not the internet. This reward of new duping method for 1000000Gc is a joke and no one will report it now. You have made people in fear of report their finding. I personally know of only one method right now . However it not worth duping anymore. As sniper rifle were duped like it was in style and people have over 100 sniper in their legit account lockbox. I can say one thing was it worth silenting your loyal fanbase.

The forum was a treasure of info. Even hacker announce their attack against you daliy. I have over 8500 post and I read the forum and never forget them. They would make spam site and hack login and many other thing. Almost half of the trader there was a hacker or is hacker. I know them by their name. I personally feel that you should bring back gc trading at least then you can make money from that. Instead of them using the black market.
I have many thing I wish to tell you however I want to leave it one positive note. Dev and staff of OP Production this game is wonderful and it even could have been a great success However you just keep making the same mistake over and over again. I have tell you the flaw of them. If you choose to listen or don't. I personally hope do success but I believe your flaws will caught up to you.

Love you lot Black Lotus

reviewText: This game is truly amazing. The way the devs pulled together flying zombies and zombies with slenderman arms that can grab you from ten feet away is just a perfect mix to this game.  It's soooo good.  I love the fact to that I can buy whatever I want and can go around slaughtering those slenderman zombies.  There's also zombies in the game that are like the Flash and sprint 1000 miles per hour towards you and frog jumping zombies that hop towards you and slap you once for 99.9% of your health, then you start bleeding 20 seconds later and die.  And can I tell you about how amazing the vehicles are.  The vehicles are so relistic.  The driving makes Forza look like a playground.  When I first started playing this game, I was instantly impressed on how much character customization there was.  My character was so sexy I instantly started jerking off to his beautiful bald head and nice body.  The load times for the game is fantastic.  Never in my life have I seen a game load as fast as it does.  After speedily loading into the game I saw a group of 3 people with assault rifles sprinting towards me.  I tried to run but a frog zombie caught up to me and bent me over and ♥♥♥♥♥ me over a fence.  I was so pleased with the gameplay that I went to a dollar tree and robbed the cash register for money to revive my character and give him some melee weapons.  Shortly after I used my map to head towards a military base called Norad.  There I found a gigantic white zombie and knew I wanted him in my butt.  I smiled at him and was mesmerized by his skill of trying to grab my ♥♥♥ through a wall.  I knew he was a fiesty one and ran towards him, in one punch he knocked me out and ♥♥♥♥♥ my unaware body.  I know this because I woke up and felt like my  ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ was bigger.  It was so good that it knocked me all the way to an airport where I found a gun.  I treasured this pistol it looked like an angel to me I quickly left the game to save my pistol.  I went to sleep and dreamed about how those zombie penetrated me.  I woke up to find my mom playing the game.  She was in a trance shortly after she started laughing histerically.  I saw her go out to the kitchen and grab a knife.  She walded towards me and took my favorite stuffed animal and beheaded it as to please the dev gods.  She then ate the stuffing of my animal and wore its ur as a hat.  I knew something was wrong and I was my mom get 24 kills without dying.  She then called in a MOAB and blew up the whole map getting even more kills.  The devs were so pleased they rode into my house on a unicorn and asked my mom to join them in being a dev.  My mom smiled from ear to ear, and the dev lifted her on to the unicron by her ♥♥♥.  I knew my mom had to do this, so a waved bye and thought of how wonderful the game was.

reviewText: This game was very fun for me for a while then i realized how many people actually do have hacks and esp's. The servers are not well kept and are filled with snipers with aimbots or speed hacks. There is not much to do except collect gear and run through the world and get mad ever time a hacker walks through the wall and kills you. Its only 5 dollars though so if you looking for a cheap way to get really ♥♥♥♥♥♥ off very quickly then ISS is the game for you. The only up side to all this NOTHING there is no upside. I have a good bit of time on this game and ton's of gear but still its really not all worth it even with a new map there is still nothing to do. The developers really need to get there Sh$$ togeather and fix the real problems before they add things into the game. The Devs are not very nice either. They are very money hungry they took the survival away from the game when they put an in game store into the mix. So if your a hacker or just have money to spare you can just gear up and get all the ammo and armor/meds that you want and never loose. My conclusion to all this ramble is if you want to get a cheap survival game for 5 bucks please please please dont buy this one i can assure you it is a huge waist of your time.

reviewText:
To be honest, I really don't mind playing I:SS. I picked this up during the summer sale a year ago I think, and I enjoyed playing it for the first hour. After that, the magic's gone. Everyone is constantly paranoid and the KoS is not a problem, it's a fact. I can't remember the last time someone actually talked to me in this without immediately shooting me or getting their friends to kill me. Not to mention the lack of communication is kinda a bust, the majority of people would rather kill you for your flashlight and Granola bars, then proceed to t-bag you and write 2nd grade insults at you.

In short, the gameplay is at times frustrating/painful, but makes up for when you get items, the developers (In my opinion) are getting alot better with the updates/feedback/community for the game, but the weakest link in this has to be the few ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s that kill for ♥♥♥♥ all and ruin the experience for many.

With that said and done, I don't recommend I:SS with the amount of ♥♥♥♥ you have to deal with as a new player coming into this game, but play at your own risk.

reviewText: My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, 'If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately.' Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me- 'Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through. I agreed. To this day
date: I have never touched a cigarette. I must say
recommended: I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it
hoursPlayed: because this game gave me cancer anyway."

reviewText: I bought this game with high expectations, from the cool screenshots and trailer, little did I know that those were all taken in high settings. Every single time you spawn in you get rekt by the zombies or get spawn killed because the spawns are terrible. If you are reading this review to see if you should buy this I tell you HELL NO YOU SHOULDN'T GET THIS GAME!! It is so terrible that you should probably lick a cactus, if you have bought this game please gauge your eyes  out because of the ♥♥♥♥ graphics. I'm almost positive that the most fun part of this game is watching it be refunded because it is terrible on so many levels. The community is filled with little 3 year-old fanboys that think this is the best thing since sliced bread. I recommend that no one should get this game EVER, but what I do recommend doing over playing this COMPLETE AND UTTER ♥♥♥♥ GAME is rubbing your balls against a cactus...
